articles.title: Follow live: Bucs, 49ers facing off in matchup of NFC division leaders
Tua calls out some Fins for meeting attendance
articles.summary: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa said Sunday that some of his teammates are showing up late or not at all to player-led meetings.

articles.title: Banged-up 49ers lose top LB Warner to injury
articles.summary: The San Francisco 49ers took another significant injury hit Sunday when linebacker Fred Warner departed in the first quarter with a right ankle injury.

articles.title: Nacua limited by ankle injury; Week 7 status TBD
articles.summary: Rams star WR Puka Nacua's status for Week 7 against the Jaguars is in question following an ankle injury that limited him in Sunday's win.

articles.title: Glenn defends Fields despite Jets' -10 pass yards
articles.summary: Quarterback Justin Fields received a strong vote of confidence from coach Aaron Glenn despite the worst passing performance in Jets history.

articles.title: Colts' Richardson has orbital fracture from mishap
articles.summary: Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. sustained an orbital fracture during pregame warmups and was inactive for his team's 31-27 victory over game the Cardinals.

articles.title: Bengals TE Gesicki (pec) exits against Packers
articles.summary: Bengals tight end Mike Gesicki was ruled out of Sunday's game against the Packers with a pectoral injury.

articles.title: Sanchez booked in jail, says focus on recovery
articles.summary: Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez has been booked and released from a jail in Indianapolis, telling a reporter that he was focused on his recovery from stab wounds he suffered in the altercation that resulted in multiple charges against him.

articles.title: Cards WR Harrison suffers concussion, ruled out
articles.summary: Cardinals wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. was ruled out against the Colts with a concussion.

articles.title: 🏈 Reid's 2026 draft QB rankings: Who's No. 1?
articles.summary: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We ranked the top 14 who could get picked -- including a few playing against each other this week.

articles.title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 6: Panthers squeak by against Cowboys, Jets remain winless
articles.summary: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

articles.title: Buzz: Dowdle stars again with 239 yards; Is Hubbard's starting job in jeopardy?
articles.summary: A closer look at what stood out from Sunday's first set of games, including Rico Dowdle combining for 239 yards and potentially shaking up Carolina's RB depth chart.

articles.title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What did we learn about the QB class Saturday?
articles.summary: Has anyone emerged as the 2026 draft class' QB1 yet? We have notes and updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 7.

articles.title: 60K club: Stafford moves into ninth as Rodgers closes in on Roethlisberger for fifth
articles.summary: Matthew Stafford needed 191 yards coming into Week 1 to join the prestigious quarterback club.

articles.title: Best of NFL Week 6's arrivals, featuring Daniel Jones' Colts guitar
articles.summary: The stars are back in the pregame tunnels, arriving in looks that match their personal style.

articles.title: The Broncos are a defensive-based team, and that's what they need to be right now
articles.summary: Sean Payton is known for his great offenses. But after another big day on the other side of the ball, he knows Denver has a defensive personality.

articles.title: Pain, rehab and unlikely inspiration: Inside Aidan Hutchinson's return to dominance
articles.summary: Hutchinson's long journey back from a broken leg found inspiration from children whom he has inspired, too.

articles.title: Why the 2025 NFL season has seen a historic number of last-minute drives
articles.summary: The 17 games that featured a go-ahead score in the final minute of regulation are the most through five weeks of a season since the merger.

articles.title: The AFC North QB landscape is not what it was to start the season: What's going on?
articles.summary: It's a bizarre time in the division with Aaron Rodgers the only starting QB who began 2025 in that capacity for the same team.
